name: Drune
description: A sinister cabal of sorcerers who covet occult knowledge above all else.

enclaves.name: Drune Lodge
enclaves.summary: Centre of Drune activity; hidden doors and catacombs beneath Droun Loch; home of the Elder Phanatarch and the Aegis.

enclaves.name: Dwelmfurgh
enclaves.summary: The area around Lake Longmere within the circle of Chell; Drune heartland where their word is law.

enclaves.name: Odd (Village) — Church Monolith
enclaves.summary: The Drune secretly control Odd and the monolith integrated into its disused church.

enclaves.name: Drodh

resources.name: Geomancy and Ley-Mastery
resources.description: Secret arts to harness and manipulate earth energies via standing stones; mapped greater and lesser leys; Audrunes know ley-travel to locations and otherworldly realms.

resources.name: Wardens of the Ring of Chell
resources.description: Maintain the vast artificial ley encircling Dwelmfurgh, preventing the Cold Prince from returning; vigil is relentless and lethal.

resources.name: Hoarded Arcane Knowledge
resources.description: Knowledge is sacred, valued above mortal life; Drune rede: “Seek, Know, Keep.”

resources.name: Occult Binding and Subjugation
resources.description: Power amplified through spirits and godlings bound and subjugated; kidnapping and sacrifice feared as fates worse than death.

resources.name: Magic of Shadow and Flame
resources.description: All Drunes see in utter blackness and may summon flickering green flames at will.

resources.name: Constructs of Wicker and Bramble
resources.description: Occult command of wood and plants; creation of servitors of wood, wicker, and bramble.

resources.name: Distributed Drune Society Network
resources.description: Aegis bureaucracy, Audrune hermits, cottager scavengers/poison-brewers/omen-watchers, Drunewives with enchanted notions and kilnlings, wandering Braithmaids, and Lampers trained for initiation.

goals.name: Maintain the Ring of Chell
goals.notes: Chief Drune activity: tend the Ring of Chell around Dwelmfurgh to prevent the Cold Prince’s return; they tolerate no rival in arcane dominion.

goals.name: Reawaken the Entity Gheillough
goals.notes: Seek to restore contact with the mysterious power in Lake Longmere’s waters (lost when the Nag-Lord tainted the lake).

goals.name: Entrap and Subjugate Atanuwë
goals.notes: Treat Atanuwë as a godling whose powers must be subjugated and harnessed; success would nearly complete Drune occult dominion.

goals.name: Reclaim Dominion Over Lost Nodals
goals.notes: Recover Sargstone (0904) stolen by Atanuwë and address Bafflestone (0907) corrupted by Atanuwë.

goals.name: Locate the Energy Disturbance on Ywyr
goals.notes: Investigate fluctuations suggesting an unlawful fifth nodal along ley line Ywyr; the stone is concealed in Chateau Mauvesse (1802) by Ygraine’s magic.

action_library.name: Reinforce and inspect the Ring of Chell

on_complete.text: Hooded figures were seen at dusk, pacing the invisible circle of Chell; the air smelled of ozone and green flame.

action_library.name: Conduct rites to reawaken Gheillough at Lake Longmere

on_complete.text: Strange dreams ripple through Dwelmfurgh—some swear the lake itself has begun to whisper again.

action_library.name: Gather materials and victims for a binding snare against Atanuwë

on_complete.text: Disappearances in the hamlets have increased; folk mutter of the Hooded Men and rites beneath the loch.

action_library.name: Attempt to wrest Sargstone back from Atanuwë
Contain the corruption radiating from Bafflestone

on_complete.text: A sickly shimmer over the stones has dulled—temporarily—after a night of chanting and green fire.

action_library.name: Survey ley line Ywyr to locate the concealed fifth nodal

on_complete.text: A Drune hermit was seen taking star-maps and plumb-lines toward the old chateau; birds fell silent in his wake.

action_library.name: Pursue a deeper alliance with the witches
Procure saintly relics to weaponize against Atanuwë

on_complete.text: A reliquary went missing from a roadside chapel; wax dripped like tears where the seal had been cut.

tiers.name: The Aegis (High Council)
members: High council dwelling in Drune Lodge; coordinate occult schemes, judge conflicts, and set policy.

tiers.name: The Drunemoot
members: Moonlit meetings overseen by Aegis members to mete out justice or discuss affairs; up to ~30 Drunes, often fewer.

tiers.name: Audrunes
members: Sub-order tasked with nodal stones and ley-lines; hermit-like wardens; hold secrets of ley-travel.

tiers.name: Cottagers
members: Isolated Drune men and families; scavenge ruins for grimoires, dream-talk to ghosts, brew poisons, record omens, track noble houses until called by Aegis.

tiers.name: Drunewives
members: Practice inherited crafts (herbalism, pottery, song); enchanted 'notions'; construct clay servitors called 'kilnlings'; manage household property.

tiers.name: Braithmaids
members: Adolescent daughters roaming wilds; sing enchanted melodies; forage magical herbs; may become Drunewives or join witches.

tiers.name: Lampers
members: Adolescent sons in gruelling ritual/occult study; initiated on 17th birthday; only Drune-born sons become Drunes; each born into a station.

organization.notes: The Drune are a folk apart, marrying only among themselves; feared by common folk who avoid speaking their true name.

caduceus_doome_elder_phanatarch.appearance: Gaunt, vault-pale human man of imposing height; crowned with finger bones; swathed in black; bramble-tangled hair and beard; green fire in his pupils.
caduceus_doome_elder_phanatarch.demeanour: Neutral; cool-minded, scheming, manipulative; pulls at bony fingers as if removing rings.

speech.style: Dispassionate whisper that penetrates all noise.

desires: Forge a deeper alliance with the witches, uniting occult energies of male and female.
Procure saintly relics and turn their power against Atanuwë.

vorpal_knife.name: Vorpal Knife
effects: Arcane Dagger of black iron; on natural 19–20 attack roll, decapitates Small/Medium targets (natural 20 for solid stone/metal).
Creatures without heads are unaffected; some headed creatures (e.g., constructs) are not killed by decapitation.
Wearer ages at one-fifth normal rate.
Wearer experiences fever dreams where deceased Drunes whisper their rede.
crown_of_old_droun.notes: Formed of the finger bones of prior 'Bone Kings'.

auldweathe.notes: Spirits of Braithmaids who sacrificed mortal lives to serve the king; function as guards and advisors with ancient memories.

traits: Dark sight: see normally in darkness up to 30′.
Flame: victims damaged by staff save vs Spell or take 3 damage/round for 1d4 rounds (snaking green flame).
Enter Chell: in Drune Lodge, may step into the Ring of Chell at any point around the ring.
Ley travel: in a hex crossed by a ley line, may step into the ley and travel astrally at 24 miles/hour.

aubrathon.summary: Renegade Drune genius of seven centuries past; expelled after astrally infiltrating the Witch Queen’s vaults and stealing the Onyx Mirror of Embala.

last_known_sites.site: Aubrathon’s magically veiled tower (mirror sealed within)
Monument in Northern Scratch at the site of his final discourse with his acolyte Cylaeth

drune_names.notes: Name table for Drune NPCs; surnames and forenames used across Drune society.

overview.masters_of_stones: Unchallenged masters of Dolmenwood’s standing stones and nodal stones, except Bafflestone (corrupt), Phandrwyl (secret by Ygraine), and Sargstone (usurped by Atanuwë).
overview.audrunes: Audrunes are the designated masters of leys, guarding stones and knowing the secrets of travel along leys and into otherworldly realms.
overview.ring_of_chell: They tend the Ring of Chell encircling Dwelmfurgh, barring the Cold Prince from the mortal world.
overview.culture: A folk apart, marrying only among themselves; common folk avoid speaking their accursed true name, using euphemisms like 'Watchers of the Wood'.

schemes.reawaken_gheillough: Reawaken the lake-entity Gheillough, contact lost when the Nag-Lord tainted Lake Longmere.
schemes.subjugate_atanuwe: Bind and harness Atanuwë’s godling power to complete occult dominion.
schemes.reclaim_lost_nodals: Recover Sargstone and address corruption of Bafflestone.
schemes.locate_fifth_nodal_ywyr: Track energy fluctuations of Ywyr to locate a concealed unlawful nodal in Chateau Mauvesse (1802).

enclaves.drune_lodge: Hidden doors and catacombs beneath Droun Loch; guarded by great magic, invisible and unlocatable to non-Drune.
enclaves.dwelmfurgh: Heartland within the circle of Chell around Lake Longmere; their word is law.
enclaves.odd: Secret control over the village and its church monolith.

magic_notes.binding_subjugation: They derive potency from bound spirits and godlings; apply techniques to lesser beings to amplify or create arcane force.
magic_notes.shadow_flame: All Drunes can see in utter blackness and summon green flames.
magic_notes.constructs: They command wood and plants, creating servitors of wood, wicker, and bramble.

aubrathon.summary: Renegade Aegis member and genius theoretician; expelled after stealing the Onyx Mirror of Embala from the Witch Queen’s vaults.
aubrathon.notes: Some Drunes later honoured his innovation and erected a monument where he last spoke with his acolyte Cylaeth before vanishing north into the bog.
